args:
Ieyasu defeats the fiends and reveals the truth
of the Twelve Wyrmclans to Botan. Thus having
reconciled, they return to the castle with the
prince, where the New Year's party gets a fresh
start. The gift-gathering then begins anew,
with Hinomoto challenging Alberia.
What, back again? You got pluck,\nI'll give you that—but this ends now!
I wield the blade of daybreak to\ndrive back the wicked!
Back to the dust with you!\nDaybreak Flurry!
Just a scratch. I'm totally fin—OWWW!
Come. I will see to your wounds.
I don't need any help from you!
Be silent and let me see!
There, that should do it. I'm glad it wasn't\nas bad as it seemed.
Just to be safe, we'll have Cleo take a\ncloser look when we get back.
Now then, Botan—are you a fool?!\nHave you any idea how rash your\nactions were?!
And yet, taking on a vast number of fiends\nalone is foolishness itself!
Then what say you about your injury?
Those who misread their own strength are\nnot strong, but instead the basest of fools.
...But in this case, it is I who am the fool.
For you only attempted this dangerous\ngame because of my actions.
I now realize the great truth of\n{player_name}'s words.

For your sake as my friend, I put you at
a distance, but in the end this brought
only sadness upon you—which was
the very thing I wanted to avoid.
Let me explain the truth of the Twelve\nWyrmclans to you now.
Is this the reason you abandoned me?
Yes. The heads of the Twelve Wyrmclans\nare permitted to forge pacts between a\ndragon and their own soul—a soulpact.
The strength of a dragon is mighty indeed.\nBut alas, there must by necessity be an\nequivalent price paid for such power.
I don't like where this is going...
The soul provides an intermediary for the\nsoulpact. This is inescapable.
Thus, those who form this pact are doomed\nto a shortened life.
So you aren't just joining your soul to\nthe dragon? You're actually offering it\nup as some kind of...sacrifice?

This is why the successor family has
twelve branches—so when the shogun
dies, there is assured to be at least one
heir ready to take their place.
You make it sound like you're disposable!
No one can replace you, Ieyasu!\nWhy would you ever agree to this?!
It is because I love Hinomoto.\nMy family is there.\nMy people are there.
And my dearest friends will live on there.
I would sacrifice my life without regret\nif it allowed me to protect them thus.
And so that was the reason...?
Indeed. I could not bear for you to face\nthe pain you feel at this very moment,\nwhich is why I separated from you.
Not to mention that being a successor\ncandidate to the shogun is fraught with\nmany dangers unrelated to my soul.
You cared not for the trappings of house\nand title, and for that, I fervently wished\nto avoid involving you in such dangers.
You thought I was so weak that you\ncouldn't just tell me the truth?
It had nothing to do with strength;\nI simply couldn't bear your sadness.
So yes, this is all a huge shock.\nAnd yes, it makes me very sad.
But I'm not the kind of girl who sits around\nWALLOWING in her sadness!
You decided to put your life on the line\nfor your people and your friends, right?
Well, I'm going to support you in that\nso you can fulfill your duty without regret.
And if you'd just told me all this earlier,\nI never would have tried to make you\nfail your assignment!
My dear Botan... I am so terribly sorry\nfor ignoring your feelings.
Could you possibly find it within\nyourself to forgive me?
I came after you so we could have the\nkind of friendship we used to!
So yes, idiot! Of COURSE I can forgive you!
I...see. In that case, I, too, hope that we\nmight rekindle our old ways.
Botan hurt her arm. Could you take a look\nat it, Cleo?
Oh, it's nothing. Look, see?\nDoesn't even hurt anymore.
Let's just have her examine it anyway.
Right? I figured she woulda bitten off\nIeyasu's head by now.
Have you and Botan worked things out,\nMaster Ieyasu?
I believe we have—and it's thanks\nto {player_name}.
I had simply never considered trying to\novercome our sadness together.
If it makes you feel better, I understand\nwhere you were coming from.
But I met your friend and realized there\nare some troubles we have to overcome\nwith the help of another.
In good times or bad, it's always better\nto face them with someone you like.
Hmm... Mutual exchange, rather than\nunilateral service...
I believe I had forgotten this truth since\ntaking on my role as head of my clan.
Though you are yet young, Prince,\nI know you will make a splendid king.
Wait, that's not what I meant. It's just...
I guess I was just trying to explain what\nI was thinking.
And your thinking is splendid indeed!
Now then, my Alberian friends! I pray you\ncan forgive me for exposing a rather\nunsightly side of myself to you.
If it is acceptable, perhaps we might begin\nour New Year's hospitality anew?

Though this time, I believe we may all
enjoy the boons of said hospitality.
Let us share in a delightful party!
I'm gonna give out a TON of New\nYear's gifts to celebrate this\nmended friendship!
Aw, Cleo fixed me up good. Besides,\nthere's no injury that could keep me\nfrom a rockin' party like this!
So, let's do the gift-gathering contest\nagain! I mean, it'd be super boring to\njust hand 'em out after all this.
Great idea! I mean, how often are we\ngonna get a chance to face off against\na big ol' dragon like yours?
Bwa ha ha! I could go for a little Alberia\nversus Hinomoto action.
Sounds interesting. How about it,\nMaster Ieyasu?
If my counterpart is willing to participate,\nthen I shall do so gladly.
But I must hear the challenge accepted\nby {player_name}.
Heh. We'll give you everything we've got.
Let the second New Year's gift-gathering\ncontest begin!
